free.chess
Class ChessMove

java.lang.Object
  free.chess.Move
      free.chess.ChessMove

public class ChessMove
extends Move

An extension of the Move class for variants which have rules similar to regular chess. Mainly, it just defines the existance of concepts such as en-passant, short and long castling, captures and promotion. It provides two constructors, one which lets the caller to specify all the properties and another one which determines these properties by using the stardard chess rules.

Constructor Detail

ChessMove

public ChessMove(Square startingSquare,
                 Square endingSquare,
                 Player movingPlayer,
                 boolean isEnPassant,
                 boolean isShortCastling,
                 boolean isLongCastling,
                 ChessPiece capturedPiece,
                 ChessPiece promotionTarget,
                 java.lang.String moveSAN)
Creates a new ChessMove with the given properties. If the move is not a promotion, the promotion target should be null. The moveSAN (the move in SAN format) argument may be null.

ChessMove

public ChessMove(Position pos,
                 Square startingSquare,
                 Square endingSquare,
                 ChessPiece promotionTarget,
                 java.lang.String moveSAN)
Creates a new ChessMove from the given properties. The missing information (en-passant, castling and other information provided by the more complete constructor) is determined according to the rules of standard chess. The moveSAN (the move in SAN format) argument may be null.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the there is no piece at the starting square.
Method Detail

getWarrenSmithString

public java.lang.String getWarrenSmithString()
Returns a string representing this move in the notation invented by Warren Smith. Refer to http://www.chessclub.com/chessviewer/smith.html for a description of the notation.

Returns:
a string representing this move in the Warren Smith notation.
